data.title: Summit Waves
data.text:
Summit Waves Features

Summit Waves opened in July 2008 as Lee's Summit's first family aquatic center featuring a 904 FOOT Action River and 8000 sq ft wave pool!

The outdoor water park also features one body slide and one tube slide, a six-lane lap pool with diving boards, a water playground area featuring mini-slides, dump buckets, and more.

When taking a break enjoy the concession stand!

See our Summit Waves concessions menu here

Hours & Fees

2024 Season - Summit Waves will be open May 25 - August 18

Summit Waves Hours will be 12-7 M-F and 11-7 Sat/ Sun and Holidays. Season pass holders get in 15 minutes early.

One-Day Single Tickets

Pre-Purchase Single Day Tickets By Clicking Here - Single tickets cannot be purchased at the gate at Summit Waves

If you prefer, you can also purchase single tickets at an LSPR Community Center: Lovell Community Center, Longview Community Center, Harris Park Community Center, or Gamber Community Center.

Season Passes

Renew Your Pass By Clicking Here if you purchased a pass last year

New season passes must be purchased at any LSPR Community Center (they cannot be purchased online) - Lovell Community Center, Longview Community Center, Harris Park Community Center, or Gamber Community Center.

2024 Season Pricing LS Resident Discounted Rate Regular Rate Single Visit $11 $15 Individual Season Pass $95 $127 Twilight Visit (5-7pm Mon - Thurs) $7 $10 Rentals and Parties: Birthday Parties - Select your date in the top left corner $183 $244 Tommy Turtle Hut Rentals - Select your date in the top left corner $58 $58 Special Events: Family Fun Night, Dive in Movie and Pooch Paddle Varies Varies

Important Note Regarding Fees & Season Passes: Children ages 3 and under may enter at no charge. LSPR's ticket and season pass prices are applicable to individual admissions. Please note that LSPR does not currently offer family passes.

2024 Summit Waves Inclement Weather Policy

Weather conditions, Attraction & Pool Closing

Due to the significant operating costs of Summit Waves, prudent management practice dictates that a policy is in place for inclement weather, cold weather and/or significantly low attendance. Closure of the facility will be based on at least one of the following parameters:

Low Attendance (after 2 pm) – 30 patrons or less in the facility for at least 30 minutes,

Inclement Weather

Cold Weather – if the combined water and air temperature is less than 140 degrees and there are 30 patrons or less in the facility for at least 30 minutes.

Patrons will be given 15 minutes to exit the facility, and they may use the pool phone to contact a ride, if necessary.

Single Visit Tickets: When the facility closes for the day for inclement weather, single visit ticket holders on site will be issued a complimentary pass. Passes will be issued the day of the closure for admittance equal to the value of their admission fee. All complimentary passes will be stamped with an expiration date must be used within 7 days. Cash refunds will not be permitted.

Facility Rules & Etiquette

Summit Waves General Pool Rules

All children under age 10 must be accompanied by an adult, age 16+.

Children not toilet trained must wear a swim diaper and appropriate swim attire. Swim diapers are available for purchase at the Welcome Desk.

An adult may not supervise more than 8 children and must maintain visual contact at all times.

Single-visit patrons who leave the facility must purchase another single-visit pass for re-entry.

Lost or stolen articles are the responsibility of the owner. Lockers are available for patrons. Patrons can bring their own lock or locks are available for purchase at the Welcome Desk.

Toys (non-metal) are allowed in the zero-depth entry pool only. Soft throw toys may be used in the lap pool. Dive sticks are NOT allowed.

Personal Flotation Device use is limited to those approved by the US Coast Guard. A limited amount of life jackets will be provided by Summit Waves for the convenience of our patrons. Personal Flotation Devices are not allowed on the slides, diving boards, or in diving area.

Admittance to the pool will be refused for: drunkenness, inability to care for self, open sores, contagious disease, perceived detriment to the decorum of the pool, improper attire, and/or improper behavior.

Please follow all posted rules at special areas.

The following are not allowed at Summit Waves:

Glass containers.

Chewing gum.

Deck chairs in the concession area or in the pool.

Dangerous or offensive acts.

Alcohol.

Smokeless tobacco or smoking inside the fenced area. (This is a tobacco-free facility)

Inappropriate attire, including but not limited to: thongs, jeans, jean shorts, revealing bathing suits.

Use of any electronic, mechanical, manual, electric, digital, voltaic or other devices, instruments or means capable of recording, producing, duplicating, reproducing, storing, copying, transmitting, or displaying any visual, video, photographic, electronic, digital, recorded, or other visual images, pictures, or representations, including but not limited to any camera, photographic camera, video camera, fiber optic camera, motion picture camera, television camera, camcorder, videotaping device, or camera cell phone, in any restroom, locker room, lavatory, bathroom, shower facility, or dressing room, in any building owned, leased to, or under the control of the Parks Department in order to protect the privacy of our patrons.

Violation of rules will result in:

1st - Verbal warning.

2nd - Suspension of pool use for 1 hour.

3rd - Removal from pool/park for rest of the day.

4th - Revocation of pool pass and/or no admittance for 5 days.

5th - Revocation of pool pass and/or no admittance for the rest of the season.

Lee’s Summit Parks & Recreation (LSPR) reserves the right to…

…close the pool for special aquatic programs, unfavorable weather and/or insufficient attendance.

…change or modify the rules at any time deemed necessary.

…refuse service to any patron if it is deemed in the best interest of the facility.

All ordinances of the City of Lee’s Summit shall be enforced.

Important Numbers: Summit Waves, 969-1545. Rainout, 969-1516. Main Office, 969-1500.

Diving and Diving Board Rules

One person allowed on boards at a time.

Persons in line must wait until the previous diver has safely reached the pool ladder before climbing the diving board ladder.

Divers should exit the diving well at the nearest ladder and should not swim under the diving board.

Safe diving must be practiced.

No running, cartwheels or handstands on the board.

Inward dives and multiple bounces are prohibited.

Divers must dive straight out from the board.

Diving board fulcrums are not to be moved.

Children's Playground Rules

The kiddie slide is for patrons under 48” only. Guardians and siblings over 48” may not slide down with children. It is recommended that all sliders slide on their backs.

Users of this area must use caution at all times while engaging in activities.

Action River Rules

No climbing, standing, walking or sitting on the walls in the action river. No jumping into action river from side of pool.

Patrons may only enter the Action River at identified entrance points.

No diving in the river.

Floaters must follow direction of current at all times.

No standing on tubes.

No noodles or other flotation devices will be permitted.

Always use caution and follow staff directives when in the action river.

Waterslide Rules

Patrons must be a minimum of 42” tall to use the slide as mandated by the slide manufacturer. Lifeguards will verify each rider’s height.

Slide users must be able to climb the slide steps unassisted in order to use the slide.

Patrons who are pregnant, have a fear of heights, or have experienced heart or back problems should not use the slide.

Masks, goggles, flotation devices, and swimsuits with metal rivets are not permitted on the water slide.

Participants must line up on the stairs in single file.

Lifeguards will signal when the next slider may go.

Swimmers must go down the slide feet first, either on their back, sitting up, or on a tube supplied by Summit Waves.

Keep hands and feet inside the slide.

Do not stop on the slide.

Move away from the bottom of the slide quickly.

Patrons or lifeguards in the plunge pool may not catch sliders.

Swimmers must exit the plunge pool quickly.

Wave Pool

No inner tubes allowed in the wave pool.

US Coast Guard Approved Life Vests will be allowed for use.

No climbing or sitting on the wall in the wave pool.

No jumping into Wave Pool from side of pool.

Access to wave pool only by beach entry or lift.

When wave machine is off, ladder use to exit is available.

No deck furniture may be brought into the beach area of the pool.

2024 Events

July

Dive in Movie - July 22 - LS resident rate $11. Regular Rate $15. Get tickets here. Search "Dive" to see available dates and times. Free for season pass holders. Children must be accompanied by an adult (+18), must be 18 or older to purchase ticket(s). All ticket sales for dive-in movie night will end at 8:30 pm. Tickets purchased before 8:30 pm may access the event anytime.

8:00 pm - 10:30 pm

River Walking - Free for SW season pass holders. $7.00 for non-pass holders. Get tickets here. Search "River" to see available dates and times.

Sundays 7:15 pm-8:45 pm

Wednesdays 8:15 pm - 9:15 pm (No River Walking on July 3)

August

Family Fun Night - Aug 12. Regular rate $10. Get tickets here. Search "Family" to see available dates and times. Free for season pass holders. Children must be accompanied by an adult (+18), must be 18 or older to purchase ticket(s). All ticket sales for family fun night will end at 8:30 pm. Tickets purchased before 8:30 pm may access the event anytime.

8:00 pm - 10:30 pm

Aqua Zumba - August 17th. $12 when pre-registering. $15 a the gate. Register here.

9 pm-10 pm

Pooch Paddle - Aug 19th

5:00 - 7:00 pm

Small dogs (25 lbs and under) - 5:00 - 5:30 pm, Large dogs (over 25 lbs) - 6:00 - 7:00 pm

$7 per dog online. Get tickets here. Search "pooch".

River Walking - Free for SW season pass holders. $7.00 for non-pass holders. Get tickets here. Search "River" to see available dates and times.

Sundays 7:15 pm-8:45 pm

Wednesdays 8:15 pm - 9:15 pm

Cancellation Policy

The rental representative is eligible to reschedule or cancel their rental without penalty 30 calendar days prior to the rental date. Within 29 calendar days of the rental date cancellation by the rental representative must be submitted in writing to the Aquatics Manager. Rental Fees are not eligible for a refund within 30 calendar days of the rental.

In the case Lee’s Summit Parks and Recreation is unable to host the rental, the representative will be provided the option to reschedule or receive a full refund of all fees. Lee’s Summit Parks and Recreation has the right to cancel any rental without refund not limited to but including any rental or rental attendee is engaged or perceived to be engage in an activity which is in violation of Federal or State Laws, City Ordinances or rules and regulations of the Lee’s Summit Parks and Recreation Park Board.

Refunds allowed due to inclement weather.

Special Considerations

Lee’s Summit Parks and Recreation reserves the right to close the pool for special aquatic programs, unfavorable weather and/or insufficient attendance.

All ordinances of the City of Lee’s Summit shall be enforced.

You may bring food and beverages into Summit Waves for rentals. (No glass bottles or containers)

Alcohol is not allowed at Harris Park or at Summit Waves

City ordinance prohibits the sale & consumption of alcohol on park property.

Our Commitment

The Lee’s Summit Parks and Recreation Department is committed to providing the best park facilities and maintenance our resources will allow. The additional fees for parties and cabana rentals help offset the cost of caring for these areas and we appreciate your support. Your satisfaction as a customer is important to us and we want to know if you experience any problems with the use of our facilities.
